answers.answer: Hi!If you have recently developed 4th nerve palsy, finding the cause will treat the palsy. The commonest causes are head injury, pseudotumor cerebri or beingn intracranial hypertension, hydrocephalus, hemorrhage, edema, infections such as meningitis or herpes zoster, demyelination (multiple sclerosis), and diabetic neuropathy. Treating the cause will treat the palsy. In some cases such as MS and diabetes, it may not be treatable and you may need surgery. The decision can be made by the doctor. Take care!
